UserCode.Pets
Class Pet

java.lang.Object
  Framework.DisplayObject
      UserCode.Pets.Pet
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDisplayObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
JavaFish, SeaHorse, Urchin
public abstract class Pet
extends DisplayObject

Pet is a subclass of display object. All Fish and creatures in the aquarium will inherit the Pet class and pass their characteristics into it. Some code has been imported from Session 2 on blackboard by Marc Price. (Specifically, from JavaFish.class).

Version:
18-12-2020
Author:
Kristopher Randle & Marc Price

Constructor Detail

Pet

public Pet(java.lang.String model,
           java.lang.String tex,
           double scale)
    throws OutOfBoundsException
Constructor for objects of class Pet. Calls the constructor of its parent class DisplayObject, passing in parameters provided by each child of the Pet class.

Parameters:
model - The model of the Pet, as passed by the child class.
tex - The texture of the Pet, as passed by the child class.
scale - The scale of the Pet, as passed by the child class.
Throws:
OutOfBoundsException
Method Detail

generateRandomXSpeed

public void generateRandomXSpeed()
METHOD: used to generate a new random xSpeed for this Pet, within the specified range (0.005 - 0.05). This is used to emulate random bursts of speed within the Fish.

generateRandomYSpeed

public void generateRandomYSpeed()
METHOD: used to generate a new random ySpeed for this Pet, within the specified range (0.005 - 0.05). This is used to emulate random bursts of speed within the Fish.

getDirection

public boolean getDirection()
METHOD: GET the direction of the Pet. 'direction' is a boolean value, with the follow representations: 'true' = This Pet is swimming RIGHT. 'false' = This Pet is swimming LEFT.

Returns:
The current direction this Pet is swimming, TRUE = RIGHT, FALSE = LEFT.

getScale

public double getScale()
METHOD: GET the scale of the Pet.

Returns:
The scale of the Pet.

getX

public double getX()
METHOD: GET the x co-ordinate of the Pet.

Overrides:
getX in class DisplayObject
Returns:
The current x co-ordinate of the Pet.

getXSpeed

public double getXSpeed()
METHOD: GET the xSpeed of the Pet.

Returns:
the current speed of this Pet on the X axis.

getY

public double getY()
METHOD: GET the y co-ordinate of the Pet.

Overrides:
getY in class DisplayObject
Returns:
The current y co-ordinate of the Pet.

getYSpeed

public double getYSpeed()
METHOD: GET the ySpeed of the Pet.

Returns:
the current speed of this Pet on the Y axis.

inBounds

protected void inBounds()
METHOD: This method is the aquariums main boundary detection system. The "Pets" use this to know if they hit a wall, if they do they will swim in the opposite direction from which they came. Colliding with the RIGHT wall or the ROOF will result in this Pet receiving a random new xSpeed and ySpeed, this creates random speed bursts in the Pets.

setOrientation

protected void setOrientation(double x,
                              double y,
                              double z)
METHOD: set the orientation of the Pet in the aquarium - Method from Marc Price.

Parameters:
x - orientation about the x axis
y - orientation about the y axis
z - orientation about the z axis

setPosition

protected void setPosition()
METHOD: set the position of the Pet within the aquarium - Method from Marc Price, refactored by Kristopher Randle. X and Y is randomly set between the bounds of the aquarium by using the windows height and width. Not specifying a Pets x and y location will give them a randomly generated one. (Method Overloading)

setPosition

protected void setPosition(double x,
                           double y,
                           double z)
METHOD: set the position of the Pet in the aquarium - Method from Marc Price. This method can be used to specify the exact starting location of the Pet if the user wishes by providing an x, y and z parameter. Not providing will give them a randomly generated one via the other instance of this overloaded method.

Parameters:
x - the rqd position along the x axis
y - the rqd position along the y axis
z - the rqd position along the z axis

setSpeed

protected void setSpeed()
METHOD: set the swim speed of the Pet to a default value if parameters are not provided for it. (Method Overloading)

setSpeed

protected void setSpeed(double MAX,
                        double MIN)
METHOD: set the swim speed of the Pet with a random number between 0.005 - 0.05

Parameters:
MAX - the maximum speed the Pet can go as specified by the client.
MIN - the minimum speed the Pet can go as specified by the client.

update

public void update()
METHOD: to set the next frame of the simulation, called on each pass of the simulation - Method form Marc Price, edited by Kristopher Randle.

Specified by:
update in interface IDisplayObject
Overrides:
update in class DisplayObject

validateSpeed

public void validateSpeed()
                   throws OutOfBoundsException
METHOD: used to validate that the speed this Pet has been assigned is within the correct range, if it isn't an OutOfBoundsException is thrown which can be caught at another part in the program.

Throws:
OutOfBoundsException
